answers.answer: I'm going the water birth way & have heard nothing but great things about it. As for the c section, you may have to talk to your midwife or doctor because I'm not sure

It all depends on your reason for c section and of course how your doctor feels. My daughter for example was emergency c section due to distress. So if I go natural this time they need all the bells and whistles hooked to me. Talk to your doctor and make your wants and needs known and really discuss it in depth. Good luck!
I had to have a c section with my daughter due to preeclampsia, but there is no sign of that this time. I'm not sure if they'll let me or not. :/

I had my first an emergency csection due to his heart was skipping beats , I than found out that I'm also too small to deliver a baby and my body just won't allow it. If you can do it , go for it!!!! But if you have to get another csection look up the gentle c , and discuss it with your doctor :) I'm having my 3rd in September and just started reading about the gentle c and will hopefully be incorporating some of the stuff into the delivery
Thanks for the advice, ladies. :) I plan to discuss it with my doctor next time I see him. Wish me luck!

question: Is it possible to do a water birth after having a c-section? I have had only one c-section, so I am opting to go natural, but I am unaware of the restrictions of a water birth.If it is allowed, does anyone have success stories about it? I would love to do one if I'm able.
title: Water Birth?
